title: The Ancient Order of Bali
excerpt: In 1970s Bali, a sudden rice crisis prompted an unexpectedly far-reaching scientific discovery

title: The Vineyard Falcon Does Not Suffer Fools
excerpt: Master falconer Alina Blankenship and her mélange of raptors have become the protectors of some of Oregon's top vineyards.

title: The Strange Afterlife of George Carlin
excerpt: Nearly 14 years after his death, his provocative humor has been embraced by people across the political spectrum. What happens when comedy outlasts the era it was made for?

title: How national identities are invented
excerpt: A strong national identity is essential for any country's survival – and the easiest route to acquiring one is to unite behind a common enemy.

title: Dun, Dun Duuun! Where did pop culture’s most dramatic sound come from?
excerpt: Did the iconic three-note sequence come from Stravinsky, the Muppets or somewhere else? Our writer set out to – dun, dun duuuun! – reveal the mystery

title: Hatch green chiles are feeling the heat
excerpt: Growers of New Mexico’s iconic crop wrestle with drought, water rights and labor shortages.

title: The Weird History of Hillbilly TV — THE BITTER SOUTHERNER
excerpt: Gabe Bullard takes a long, hard look at the history of hillbilly TV, from Andy Griffith to “Duck Dynasty.”

title: The Untouchables
excerpt: Why it’s getting harder to stop multinational corporations.

title: Perspective | Blight wiped out the American chestnut. Parallel efforts are close to bringing it back.
excerpt: One method, the slow, methodical work of traditional hybridization, is long familiar. The other, genetic engineering, is more controversial.

title: How Legalization Changed Humboldt County Marijuana
excerpt: In an isolated Northern California community, the last remnants of the counterculture are confronting the future of cannabis.

title: The Super Bowl of Beekeeping
excerpt: Almond growing in California is a $7.6 billion industry that wouldn’t be possible without the 30 billion bees (and hundreds of human beekeepers) who keep the trees pollinated — and whose very existence is in peril.

title: What a Russian Smile Means - Issue 61: Coordinates
excerpt: How culture and history make American and Russian smiles different.
